00022 /* standard includes. */
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 #include <stdlib.h>
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <unistd.h>
00027 #include <netdb.h>
00028 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00029 #include <netinet/in.h>
00030 #include <sys/types.h>
00031 #include <sys/socket.h>
00032 
00033 /* local defines. */
00034 #define MAX_LINE (1024 * 1024)  /* 1Mbyte. */
00035 
00036 /* my includes. */
00037 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00038 
00039 /* externs. */
00040 extern options_info *fop;
00041 
00042 /* global messages. */
00043 static unique error_message = "[ unable to get a random message ]";
00044 static unique handle_failed = "handle_get() [client] failed to run.";
00045 
00046 /* function prototypes. */
00047 static bool handle_get (cint conn);
00048 void log_report (FILE *, unique, unique);
00049 bool client_run (struct hostent *, uint16_t);
00050 
00051 /* functions. */
00052 /* the following function tries to get
00053    a random msg from the GNU trm server
00054    and then prints it. */
00055 static bool
00056 handle_get (cint socket_fd)
00057 {
00058   /* buffer for the message. */
00059   char sentence[MAX_LINE] = { 0 };
00060 
00061   /* is used for validating. */
00062   int rval;
00063 
00064   /* try to fetch the message. */
00065   rval = recv (socket_fd, sentence, MAX_LINE, 0);
00066 
00067   /* what happened? */
00068   if (rval < 0)
00069     {
00070       if (fop->verbose)
00071         log_report (stderr, "recv()", NULL);
00072 
00073       return false;
00074     }
00075   else if (rval == 0)
00076     {
00077       /* peer has performed an orderly shutdown. */
00078       printf ("%s\n", error_message);
00079       return false;
00080     }
00081   else
00082     printf ("%s", sentence);
00083 
00084   return true;
00085 }
00086 
00087 /* the following function tries to connect with 
00088    a GNU trm server by using the `hostinfo' and
00089    `port'. */
00090 bool
00091 client_run (struct hostent * hostinfo, uint16_t port)
00092 {
00093   /* is used for creating a socket. */
00094   int client_socket;
00095 
00096   /* is used for keeping server's address, port, type of socket, ... */
00097   struct sockaddr_in server_address;
00098 
00099   /* try to create a tcp socket. */
00100   client_socket = socket (PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00101 
00102   /* what happened? */
00103   if (client_socket < 0)
00104     {
00105       if (fop->verbose)
00106         log_report (stderr, "socket() [client]", NULL);
00107 
00108       return false;
00109     }
00110 
00111   /* construct a socket address structure for the
00112      server's address on which we want to connect. */
00113   memset (&server_address, 0, sizeof (server_address));
00114   server_address.sin_family = AF_INET;
00115   server_address.sin_addr = *((struct in_addr *) hostinfo->h_addr);
00116   server_address.sin_port = port;
00117 
00118   /* try to connect to the server's socket. */
00119   if (connect
00120       (client_socket, (struct sockaddr *) &server_address,
00121        sizeof (struct sockaddr_in)) < 0)
00122     {
00123       if (fop->verbose)
00124         log_report (stderr, "connect() [client]", NULL);
00125 
00126       return false;
00127     }
00128 
00129   /* try to fetch a sentence and print it. */
00130   if (!handle_get (client_socket))
00131     {
00132       if (fop->verbose)
00133         fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", handle_failed);
00134 
00135       return false;
00136     }
00137 
00138   return true;
00139 }
